answers.answer: Could it be caffeine withdrawal? Caffeine can help with migraines, so it's a possibility. However, I doubt that is really the answer.While I completely hear you about no insurance, I really recommend a visit to a neurologist, or at least the ER.When I get really severe migraines, my doc (and the ER once) have given me Stadol. It's a shot and I guarantee it knocks me on my a$$. However, that is an emergency thing .. not for constant use. They do have a nostril version that my doc gave me to take to India with me this summer -- just because he knows what I'm like with that bad of a migraine.As far as advice at this point? aside from getting to the ER? ice packs or an ice bath ... maybe benadryl? You need to do something to stop the attack, which means interrupting the cycle of inflammation (if this is a migraine). Maybe some acupressure? I know that if you can get the body to relax, sleep, and actually get some REM sleep, you can probably stop the cycle.

question: Hello.  My husband has had migraines for about 15 years.  They had been slightly improving.  He's been to every neurologist in our area and nothing helps.  He's tried nearly every RX out there.  Now for the first time ever he's had a migraine for 5 days.  He has barely gotten out of bed in these last five days.  Has missed 3 days of work (no sick days offered...no work = no pay).  He has almost no appetite and has been complaining of alternating chills/sweats and dizziness.  He recently was diagnosed as having pre-Diabetes.  Today he went to the dr. and they had him just see the nurse practitioner.  She told him it was caffeine withdrawal??  and gave him an RX for dizziness. I am so concerned and don't know what to do.  He already has 3 RXs for migraines.  I know one for the severe ones is Maxalt (sp?).  He has no health insurance (too many pre-ex. conditions and no group plan) and he absolutely has to get back to work.  We cannot make it if he misses much more work this month.  Please help if you can.
title: Need help for prolonged 5 day migraine!
